message.content:
Below is a complete breakdown of how the “house” structure in the main image is made, which blocks from the dictionary are used, and in what order to assemble them.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  Analysis of the Main Target Image
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Block Count & Layers
  –  There are eight total “pieces” making up the final shape.  
    • Two tall blue columns (legs).  
    • One vertical red “column” in the center (actually two red cubes stacked).  
    • One wide yellow bar bridging across the middle.  
    • One green horizontal bar just below the roof.  
    • Two orange triangular wedges forming the pitched roof.  
  –  You can think of the build as having about four “levels”:  
    1) Bottom columns (blue + red stacked).  
    2) Yellow “belt” across the middle.  
    3) Green block on top.  
    4) Two orange roof wedges.

• Spatial Relationships
  –  The two tall blue legs stand on the far left and far right at the base.  
  –  The red “pillar” sits between them in the center (made by stacking two red cubes).  
  –  The long yellow bar is laid horizontally, bridging from left to right about halfway up.  
  –  A single green rectangular block lies flat on top of the red pillar (spanning the width).  
  –  Finally, two orange triangular blocks meet at the top, forming the peaked roof.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  Selection of Required Blocks from Dictionary
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below are the dictionary indices needed to match the target exactly.  Note that no rotation is allowed beyond how each piece is shown:

•  Blue Tall Columns (vertical blocks)
   –  Two copies of index 5  
•  Red Central Column
   –  Two copies of index 3 (stack these red cubes vertically)  
•  Yellow Horizontal Bar
   –  One copy of index 9  
•  Green Horizontal Bar (just under the roof)
   –  One copy of index 7  
•  Orange Triangular Roof Pieces
   –  One copy of index 13 (left-leaning roof piece)  
   –  One copy of index 14 (right-leaning roof piece)  

In total, you will use 8 pieces drawn from indices: 3, 3, 5, 5, 7, 9, 13, and 14.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  Step-by-Step Assembly Instructions
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{
  Step1: Move block with index 5   // Left blue column  
  Step2: Move block with index 5   // Right blue column  
  Step3: Move block with index 3   // Lower red cube in the center  
  Step4: Move block with index 3   // Upper red cube in the center  
  Step5: Move block with index 9   // Place the yellow bar horizontally across  
  Step6: Move block with index 7   // Green block on top (just under roof)  
  Step7: Move block with index 13  // Left orange roof wedge  
  Step8: Move block with index 14  // Right orange roof wedge  
}

Following these steps and using the blocks without altering their orientations will yield the exact structure shown in the main image.
